The concept of shares is used to arbitrate the issues associated with compute resource 
contention situations. Resource contention implies the existence of too many requests 
for resources based on the actual available resources currently in the system. If resource 
contention takes place, share values are used to prioritize compute resource access for 
all guests assigned a certain number of shares.

If a costumer has "limits" beyond the available "shares", they can consume resources intended to other costumers which can cause resource exhaustion. "Reservations" should prevent such exhaustion for other costumers though their resource requirements can no longer expand until this issue is fixed.
